item.title: Hugo usage
item.description:
Hugo deploy on Github

Created two repositories, blog and actual blog with the github name (githubname.io). Set the repositories to public, the second one is actual blog with the githubname url.

  1. clone the blog repo to the local

  2. create the new hugo site using hugo new site [. (current direcoty)] or [name of folder]

  3. cd themes and clone specific theme from github, and config toml file to set theme

  4. hugo server or hugo server -D to test local blog server

  5. using hugo new posts/post_name.md to add content

  6. Set the production repo with main branch, add the a readme file to the second repo

    git checkout -b main

    touch README.md

  7. add submodule to public folder

    git submodule add -b main [https production repo url] public

  8. build content with the theme before deploy

    hugo -t [theme name]

  9. cd public folder and push all content to github

    git add .

    git commit -m "init"

    git push origin main

    github wil automatically deploy the site from the main branch

  10. Test the new feature of youtube video Ask about this video

item.title: Nginx
item.description:
Forward proxy

  1. Primiarily serves clients
  2. used for anonymity, content filtering, bypassing restrictions

Reverse proxy

  1. Primiarily serves servers
  2. used for load balancing, caching, SSL termination, enhancing sercurity

The functionalities of Nginx as a proxy server

  1. load balancing (round-robin or other algorithm) 
    http {
   upstream [] {
       server ...
       server ...
       server ...
   }

    server {
        ...
    }
}
  2. caching (without request to server and database)
  3. security
  4. compression and segmentation

Nginx:

  1. Load balancing across multiple servers
  2. High performance web server (ideal for serving static content)
  3. Reverse proxy forwarding to appropriate back-end server
  4. sercurity features (SSL termination)

Node.js:

  1. Load balancing across multiple CPU cores.
  2. Express.js is a server framework for Node.js
  3. Used to build dynamic web apps and APIs by defining routing logic
  4. Build custom middleware (managing Gzip compression)

Nginx can be used as an ingress controller in kubernetes
